raw_response:
A Tunisian Jewish Djerban fricassé, when served, is a **fried sandwich** made from a deep-fried roll that is **golden brown, crispy on the outside, yet soft and fluffy inside**. The sandwich is typically served **hand-held on a plate or wrapped to eat by hand**, resembling a substantial sandwich rather than a soup or stew[1][2][5][6].
